getInstance

transform

public de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term transform(de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term term)
                                     throws TermTransformerException
Given an initial Term, constructs a simpler Term which "localizes" all occurences of primitive datatypes, by transforming the instances of SortDependingFunction which contain them.

As an example of how this works, consider the case where we have an instace of some class Base named "base", which as a field has an instance of some other class Inner named "inner", which in turn has a local instance of an integer named "localInt. Normally, simply transforming such a construct to an SMT-LIB formula would result in a needlesly complex expression and model, which is a waste of both resources and time invested in developing additional parsers to understand it.

What we do instead is to simply transform the construct into a local variable of our base class, giving it a name corresponding to its nesting order. In our case, such a name migh be "base$nested$localInt". When all variables have been processed like this, we end up with a greatly simplified term which can easily be expressed as an SMT-LIB construct.

This process will also remove all implied properties of internal objects, such as not-null requirements, since these are not needed in the simplified formula, and would only further pollute the SMT-LIB expression. Further, it will simplify the formula by removing unnecessary conjuntions.

Parameters:
term - the term to process
Returns:
the simplified term
Throws:
ModelGeneratorException
TermTransformerException

transformAnd

protected de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term transformAnd(de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term term)
                                           throws TermTransformerException
Simplifies an AND junctor by examining the operands. If one of them can be simplified to null, the entire junction can be replaced by the second operand. If both are simplified to null, the entire conjunction can be removed (hence this method will return null as well).

Overrides:
transformAnd in class AbstractTermTransformer
Parameters:
term -
Returns:
the transformed term
Throws:
ModelGeneratorException
TermTransformerException

transformEquals

protected de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term transformEquals(de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term term)
                                              throws TermTransformerException
In terms of logical representation, equality differs from the other comparators (leq, geq etc) in the sense that it can be applied to boolean values as well as numeric ones. Thus, it is treated differently in the sense that we simplify it the same way that we simplify junctors.

Overrides:
transformEquals in class AbstractTermTransformer
Parameters:
term -
Returns:
Throws:
ModelGeneratorException
TermTransformerException

transformNot

protected de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term transformNot(de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term term)
                                           throws TermTransformerException
Simplify a negation. If the child is simplified to null, simply return null. Otherwise, create a new negation of the simplification of the child.

Overrides:
transformNot in class AbstractTermTransformer
Parameters:
term - the term (logical negator) to simplify
Returns:
the simplified negation
Throws:
TermTransformerException

transformNull

protected de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term transformNull(de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term term)
The transformation of the nulltype is simply to return a null value.

transformOr

protected de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term transformOr(de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term term)
                                          throws TermTransformerException
Simplifies an OR junctor by examining the operands. If one of them can be simplified to null, the entire junction can be replaced by the second operand. If both are simplified to null, the entire conjunction can be removed (hence this method will return null as well).

transformSortDependentFunction

protected de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term transformSortDependentFunction(de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term term)
Given an Term of type SortDependingFunction, with a primitive type as its sort, resolve the nesting hierarchy for this variable, and encode this information as a new local variable, whose name will depend on the classes involved in the nesting hierarchy. For example, the int value x in the hiearchy main.nested.other.yetanother.x will be renamed "main$nested$other$yetanother$x", and treated simply as a local variable in the object main.

Overrides:
transformSortDependentFunction in class AbstractTermTransformer
Parameters:
term - the term to process
Returns:
a Term representing the nested variable as a local variable

transformTerm

public de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term transformTerm(de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term term)
                                         throws TermTransformerException
Simplifying ordinary Terms only amounts to removing all Boolean typed variables and constants in the Term.

Overrides:
transformTerm in class AbstractTermTransformer

Throws:
TermTransformerException
